subject: Programming
title: Ada Lovelace and the First Program
description: A short lesson to help you apply Ada Lovelace and the First Program.

hook.text: In 1843, a countess wrote instructions for a machine that didn't even exist yet.

buildup.text: Ada Lovelace saw Charles Babbage's Analytical Engine and imagined its true potential.

discovery.text: She wrote an algorithm to compute Bernoulli numbers â€” the first computer program ever.

twist.text: Babbage built the hardware concept. Lovelace saw that machines could go beyond mere math.

climax.text: She predicted computers could compose music and process symbols, not just numbers.

punchline.text: The first programmer never touched a computer.

quiz.question: What did Ada Lovelace write the first algorithm for?
